abstract: European finance ministers meeting in Brussels urged China to let its currency strengthen so Europe’s economy no longer bears the brunt of the slide in the United States dollar. The officials are stepping up complaints two weeks before a delegation led by Luxembourg’s finance minister, Jean-Claude Juncker, and the European Central Bank president, Jean-Claude Trichet, arrives in Beijing to make the case for exchange-rate revaluation.
